text: welcome to a new vlog today we'll have a
little chat on a paper displays and you
probably saw this in a post I made on my
You Tube community page a few days ago
it was about my a paper thermometer
which suddenly showed the low battery
icon and stopped working I've only had
this running for about one month and
when I received it the battery was not
connected it had one of those plastic
isolating tabs so I thought it must have
been an old battery or a bad one because
it just couldn't have run out in just
one month of usage however my viewers
quickly pointed out that they were
experiencing the same issue and it was
not the battery so the next thing I did
was to take mine apart and measure the
battery voltage and indeed they were
right the battery is not dead and it was
in fact a bad contact on the battery
socket this is pretty easy to fix I
think I just need to bend a little bit
these spring contacts to ensure a better
contact with the battery for future use
but on the same community post someone
replied the somewhat off-topic but they
said this is clearly a segment ePaper
display and that's how they can keep the
cost down and I believe this was also
mentioned in the original mailbag video
where I got this and well I agree this
may be true this video is sponsored by
jl CPC become who recently upgraded
their offer so you now get 24 hours
turnaround time and you can choose any
solder mask color for the same price of
just two dollars prototyping is now
faster and cheaper so it's definitely
worth checking them out i must say and
show you that it's not obvious just by
looking at the display we can make a
logical assumption and we may be right
based on the price but just by looking
at the display i don't think it's easy
to say that and to show you this i
prepared another ePaper display showing
a couple of digits they're similar in
size similar font i couldn't find the
exact font that they used on the xiaomi
thermometer but it's a similar 7 segment
digital phone and if i put these two
together and bring them closer to the
camera sure the two displays are a bit
different in color and contrast but I
find it impossible to tell if one is a
segment based display and the other one
is a pixel based one what could be even
more confusing when a full-screen
refresh happens the shower with
thermometer behaves in a similar fashion
by going all black and all white similar
to what a pixel-based ePaper would do
refreshing the entire display surface
now if you really want to prove this is
a segment display I think more work
needs to be done and if we just google
for the numbers we find on the flex
cable nothing really shows up but I do
notice the number is the same format as
the number we find on the flex cable
from my other ePaper display this other
display is from wave sure and I'm not
sure if wave share is a manufacturer
maybe they just use these panels made by
someone else and they just build display
modules on PCBs so that doesn't help
much in this quest on this PCB we know
they are using a small 8-bit Hall Tech
microcontroller and the part number is
HT 66 F zero one eight two and I know
Hall Tech also makes a bunch of display
controllers so I think it might be worth
checking if Hall tech makes any eight
paper display controllers because it
would make sense to get the
microcontroller in the display control
from the same manufacturer for a better
overall deal now if we do a Google
search for these keywords a paper
segment Hall tech the first result is
exactly what we are looking for
it seems hall tech makes this driver
chip and the part number is HT 16 e07
it's designed for driving a paper
segment display and it has a convenient
spy interface so it's likely the
designers of this product would have
chosen to use this display driver from
the same manufacturer now if I would
want to reverse engineer this display
maybe use it for some other purpose I
would start by probing these connections
from the microcontroller to the display
and figure out the pin out this is most
likely an SPI interface then using a
logic analyzer I will
look at the commands sent by the
microcontroller for various operations
like display refresh or display update I
will then reference the recorded
commands with the ones given in the data
sheet of this controller chip and if
they match then I would be pretty
certain that's our chip used on the
ePaper display that would confirm that
they are using an ePaper segment display
and from there it should be pretty easy
to send our own own commands and
repurpose this if and you could also go
all the way and redesign this whole
internal PCB to have another
microcontroller maybe with a Wi-Fi or a
Bluetooth connection I don't know
whatever you can't think about it
so I'm not sure I'm gonna follow that
idea it was just something that I wanted
to share with you guys the fact that
just by putting them next to each other
one could be a segment ePaper display
the other one could be pixel based and
you can't tell just by looking at them
my initial thought was just to replace
the battery but as it happens I was
already inside the unit I said why not
address this topic as well that was all
for this short week in video I hope it
is somehow useful to you maybe you learn
something from this or maybe you have
the same problem with the low battery
icon shown on this thermometer it's
likely not the battery but just a bad
contact let me know what you think in
the comments below and I will see you
next week with a new video
